    • Field Detail

      • myRobots

        private java.util.ArrayList<Robot> myRobots
        An arrayList of the Robots assigned to this CPUPlayer

    • Constructor Detail

      • CPUPlayer

        public CPUPlayer(TeamColour team,
                 int boardSize,
                 java.lang.String tankScript,
                 java.lang.String sniperScript,
                 java.lang.String scoutScript,
                 RobotObserver observer)
        Since every CPUPlayer needs to have three robots to exist this method will create those three robots; however, we need to pass in the three scripts.
        Parameters:
        tankScript - the script to be used for the tank robot
        sniperScript - the script to be used for the sniper robot
        scoutScript - the script to be used for the scout robot
        observer - RobotObserver, which would be the game manager
        team - Team color of the player
        boardSize - needed to get initialPosition

    • Method Detail

      • runScriptOnRobot

        public void runScriptOnRobot(int currentRobot)

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Unit unitToMove,
                     GameBoardHex tile)
        A method used to call the move method of the appropriate unit.
        Specified by:
        makeMove in class Player
        Parameters:
        unitToMove - the unit we are going to move
        tile - the tile we are moving the unit to Note: We don't have to test if the tile is within movement range because the game manager should have already done so. Note: unitToMove should represent a robot

      • fireUpon

        public void fireUpon(Unit unitToFire,
                     GameBoardHex tile)
        A method used to call the fire method of the appropriate unit
        Specified by:
        fireUpon in class Player
        Parameters:
        unitToFire - the unit that is going to be firing
        tile - the tile we are going to shoot Note: We don't have to test if the tile is within shooting range because the game manager should have already done so. Note: unitToFire in this case should represent a robot

      • getUnits

        public java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getUnits()
        Description copied from class: Player
        Get a list of this Player's Units. The units should be ordered in the ArrayList as Scout, Sniper, and then Tank.
        Specified by:
        getUnits in class Player
        Returns:
        This Player's Units

      • getRobot

        public Robot getRobot(ForthString destType)
        Get the Robot of this CPU player who's Unit is the same as that specified by destType.
        Parameters:
        destType - A type of Unit.
        Returns:
        The Robot r who's Unit is the same as that specified by destType, or null if destType if no Robot can be found.
